content: Ban on travel to Cuba may be lifted A bipartisan group of senators says Congress is ready to pass legislation to allow all Americans to visit Cuba. Supporters say the move would create thousands of jobs. Reporting from Washington -- A bipartisan group of senators predicted Tuesday that Congress was ready to pass legislation to allow all Americans to travel to Cuba. Removing the travel ban would produce a burst of tourism, create thousands of jobs and generate as much as $1.6 billion in business a year, an independent research group said. Full article at > >http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-cuba-travel1-2009apr01,0,4526770.story Interesting that if we can make a buck off of it that Cuba seems not to be such a bad place.

title: Ban on travel to Cuba may be lifted

content: .. Alleluia!!! It would be a tremendous boom for business and tourism for places like the Florida Keys area, and Key West, a town that has been readying itself for this occurrence for years with the infrastructure to support it. To hell with the aging anti-Castroites of South Florida who have been stonewalling this for many-many years. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
